books.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II

chapters.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:1
verses.text: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book : Sec.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:2
verses.text: I.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:3
verses.text: —On Examining Candidates for the Episcopal Office.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:4
verses.text: That a Bishop Must Be Well Instructed and Experienced in the Word.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:5
verses.text: I.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:6
verses.text: But concerning bishops, we have heard from our Lord, that a pastor who is to be ordained a bishop for the churches in every parish, must be unblameable, unreprovable, free from all kinds of wickedness common among men, not under fifty years of age; for such a one is in good part past youthful disorders, and the slanders of the heathen, as well as the reproaches which are sometimes cast upon many persons by some false brethren, who do not consider the word of God in the Gospel: "Whosoever speaketh an idle word shall give an account thereof to the Lord in the day of judgment".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:7
verses.text: And again: "By thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:8
verses.text: Let him therefore, if it is possible, be well educated; but if he be unlettered, let him at any rate be skilful in the word, and of competent age.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:9
verses.text: But if in a small parish one advanced in years is not to be found, let some younger person, who has a good report among his neighbours, and is esteemed by them worthy of the office of a bishop,—who has carried himself from his youth with meekness and regularity, like a much elder person,—after examination, and a general good report, be ordained in peace.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:10
verses.text: For Solomon at twelve years of age was king of Israel, and Josiah at eight years of age reigned righteously, and in like manner Joash governed the people at seven years of age.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:11
verses.text: Wherefore, although the person be young, let him be meek, gentle, and quiet.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:12
verses.text: For the Lord God says by Esaias: "Upon whom will I look, but upon him who is humble and quiet, and always trembles at my words?" In like manner it is in the Gospel also: "Blessed are the meek: for they shall inherit the earth".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:13
verses.text: Let him also be merciful; for again it is said: "Blessed are the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:14
verses.text: Let him also be a peacemaker; for again it is said: "Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the sons of God".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:15
verses.text: Let him also be one of a good conscience, purified from all evil, and wickedness, and unrighteousness; for it is said again: "Blessed are the pure in heart: for they shall see God".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:16
verses.text: What Ought to Be the Characters of a Bishop and of the Rest of the Clergy.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:17
verses.text: II.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:18
verses.text: Let him therefore be sober, prudent, decent, firm, stable, not given to wine; no striker, but gentle; not a brawler, not covetous; "not a novice, lest, being puffed up with pride, he fall into condemnation, and the snare of the devil: for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:19
verses.text: Such a one a bishop ought to be, who has been the "husband of one wife," who also has herself had no other husband, "ruling well his own house".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:20
verses.text: In this manner let examination be made when he is to receive ordination, and to be placed in his bishopric, whether he be grave, faithful, decent; whether he hath a grave and faithful wife, or has formerly had such a one; whether he hath educated his children piously, and has "brought them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord;" whether his domestics do fear and reverence him, and are all obedient to him: for if those who are immediately about him for worldly concerns are seditious and disobedient, how will others not of his family, when they are under his management, become obedient to him?  In What Things a Bishop is to Be Examined Before He is Ordained.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:21
verses.text: III.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 1:22
verses.text: Let examination also be made whether he be unblameable as to the concerns of this life; for it is written: "Search diligently for all the faults of him who is to be ordained for the priesthood".

chapters.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:1
verses.text: Sec.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:2
verses.text: II.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:3
verses.text: —On the Character and Teaching of the Bishop.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:4
verses.text: On which account let him also be void of anger; for Wisdom says: "Anger destroys even the prudent".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:5
verses.text: Let him also be merciful, of a generous and loving temper; for our Lord says: "By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye love one another".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:6
verses.text: Let him be also ready to give, a lover of the widow and the stranger; ready to serve, and minister, and attend; resolute in his duty; and let him know who is the most worthy of his assistance.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:7
verses.text: That Charitable Distributions are Not to Be Made to Every Widow, But that Sometimes a Woman Who Has a Husband is to Be Preferred: and that No Distributions are to Be Made to Any One Who is Given to Gluttony, Drunkenness, and Idleness.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:8
verses.text: IV.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:9
verses.text: For if there be a widow who is able to support herself, and another woman who is not a widow, but is needy by reason of sickness, or the bringing up many children, or infirmity of her hands, let him stretch out his hand in charity rather to this latter.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:10
verses.text: But if any one be in want by gluttony, drunkenness, or idleness, he does not deserve any assistance, or to be esteemed a member of the Church of God.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:11
verses.text: For the Scripture, speaking of such persons, says: "The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom, and is not able to bring it to his mouth again".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:12
verses.text: And again: "The sluggard folds up his hands, and eats his own flesh".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:13
verses.text: "For every drunkard and whoremonger shall come to poverty, and every drowsy person shall be clothed with tatters and rags".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:14
verses.text: And in another passage: "If thou give thine eyes to drinking and cups, thou shalt afterwards walk more naked than a pestle".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:15
verses.text: For certainly idleness is the mother of famine.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:16
verses.text: That a Bishop Must Be No Accepter of Persons in Judgment; That He Must Possess a Gentle Disposition, and Be Temperate in His Mode of Life.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:17
verses.text: V.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:18
verses.text: A bishop must be no accepter of persons; neither revering nor flattering a rich man contrary to what is right, nor overlooking nor domineering over a poor man.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:19
verses.text: For, says God to Moses, "Thou shalt not accept the person of the rich, nor shalt thou pity a poor man in his cause: for the judgment is the Lord's".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:20
verses.text: And again: "Thou shalt with exact justice follow that which is right".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:21
verses.text: Let a bishop be frugal, and contented with a little in his meat and drink, that he may be ever in a sober frame, and disposed to instruct and admonish the ignorant; and let him not be costly in his diet, a pamperer of himself, given to pleasure, or fond of delicacies.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:22
verses.text: Let him he patient and gentle in his admonitions, well instructed himself, meditating in and diligently studying the Lord's books, and reading them frequently, that so he may be able carefully to interpret the Scriptures, expounding the Gospel in correspondence with the prophets and with the law; and let the expositions from the law and the prophets correspond to the Gospel.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:23
verses.text: For the Lord Jesus says: "Search the Scriptures; for they are those which testify of me".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:24
verses.text: And again: "For Moses wrote of me".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:25
verses.text: But, above all, let him carefully distinguish between the original law and the additional precepts, and show which are the laws for believers, and which the bonds for the unbelievers, lest any should fall under those bonds.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:26
verses.text: Be careful, therefore, O bishop, to study the word, that thou mayest be able to explain everything exactly, and that thou mayest copiously nourish thy people with much doctrine, and enlighten them with the light of the law; for God says: "Enlighten yourselves with the light of knowledge, while we have yet opportunity".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:27
verses.text: That a Bishop Must Not Be Given to Filthy Lucre, Nor Be a Surety Nor an Advocate.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:28
verses.text: VI.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:29
verses.text: Let not a bishop be given to filthy lucre, especially before the Gentiles, rather suffering than offering injuries; not covetous, nor rapacious; no purloiner; no admirer of the rich, nor hater of the poor; no evil-speaker, nor false witness; not given to anger; no brawler; not entangled with the affairs of this life; not a surety for any one, nor an accuser in suits about money; not ambitious; not double-minded, nor double-tongued; not ready to hearken to calumny or evil-speaking; not a dissembler; not addicted to the heathen festivals; not given to vain deceits; not eager after worldly things, nor a lover of money.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:30
verses.text: For all these things are opposite to God, and pleasing to demons.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:31
verses.text: Let the bishop earnestly give all these precepts in charge to the laity also, persuading them to imitate his conduct.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:32
verses.text: For, says He, "Do ye make the children of Israel pious".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:33
verses.text: Let him be prudent, humble, apt to admonish with the instructions of the Lord, well-disposed, one who has renounced all the wicked projects of this world, and all heathenish lusts; let hint be orderly, sharp in observing the wicked, and taking heed of them, but yet a friend to all; just, discerning; and whatsoever qualities are commendable among men, let the bishop possess them in himself.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:34
verses.text: For if the pastor be unblameable as to any wickedness, he will compel his own disciples, and by his very mode of life press them to become worthy imitators of his own actions.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:35
verses.text: As the prophet somewhere says, "And it will be, as is the priest, so is the people;" for our Lord and Teacher Jesus Christ, the Son of God, began first to do, and then to teach, as Luke somewhere says: "which Jesus began to do and to teach".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:36
verses.text: Wherefore he says: "Whosoever shall do and teach, he shall be called great in the kingdom of God".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:37
verses.text: For you bishops are to be guides and watchmen to the people, as you yourselves have Christ for your guide and watchman.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:38
verses.text: Do you therefore become good guides and watchmen to the people of God.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:39
verses.text: For the Lord says by Ezekiel, speaking to every one of you: "Son of man, I have given thee for a watchman to the house of Israel; and thou shalt hear the word from my mouth, and shalt observe, and shalt declare it from me.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:40
verses.text: When I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; if thou dost not speak to warn the wicked from his wickedness, that wicked man shall die in his iniquity, and his blood will I require at thine hand.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:41
verses.text: But if thou warn the wicked from his way, that he may turn from it, and he does not turn from it, he shall die in his iniquity, and thou hast delivered thy soul".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:42
verses.text: "In the same manner, if the sword of war be approaching, and the people set a watchman to watch, and he see the same approach, and does not forewarn them, and the sword come and take one of them, he is taken away in his iniquity; but his blood shall be required at the watchman's hand, because he did not blow the trumpet.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:43
verses.text: But if he blew the trumpet, and he who heard it would not take warning, and the sword come and take him away, his blood shall be upon him, because he heard the trumpet and took not warning.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:44
verses.text: But he who took warning has delivered his soul; and the watchman, because he gave warning, shall surely live".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:45
verses.text: The sword here is the judgment; the trumpet is the holy Gospel; the watchman is the bishop, who is set in the Church, who is obliged by his preaching to testify and vehemently to forewarn concerning that judgment.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:46
verses.text: If ye do not declare and testify this to the people, the sins of those who are ignorant of it will be found upon you.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:47
verses.text: Wherefore do you warn and reprove the uninstructed with boldness, teach the ignorant, confirm those that understand, bring back those that go astray.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:48
verses.text: If we repeat the very same things on the same occasions, brethren, we shall not do amiss.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:49
verses.text: For by frequent hearing it is to be hoped that some will be made ashamed, and at least do some good action, and avoid some wicked one.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:50
verses.text: For says God by the prophet: "Testify those things to them; perhaps they will hear thy voice".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:51
verses.text: And again: "If perhaps they will hear, if perhaps they will submit".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:52
verses.text: Moses also says to the people: "If hearing thou wilt hear the Lord God, and do that which is good and right in His eyes".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:53
verses.text: And again: "Hear, O Israel; the Lord our God is one Lord".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:54
verses.text: And our Lord is often recorded in the Gospel to have said: "He that hath ears to hear, let him hear".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:55
verses.text: And wise Solomon says: "My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and reject not the laws of thy mother".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 2:56
verses.text: And, indeed, to this day men have not heard; for while they seem to have heard, they have not heard aright, as appears by their having left the one and only true God, and their being drawn into destructive and dangerous heresies, concerning which we shall speak again afterwards.

chapters.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:1
verses.text: Sec.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:2
verses.text: III.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:3
verses.text: —How the Bishop is to Treat the Innocent, the Guilty, and the Penitent.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:4
verses.text: What Ought to Be the Character of the Initiated.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:5
verses.text: VII.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:6
verses.text: Beloved, be it known to you that those who are baptized into the death of our Lord Jesus are obliged to go on no longer in sin; for as those who are dead cannot work wickedness any longer, so those who are dead with Christ cannot practice wickedness.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:7
verses.text: We do not therefore believe, brethren, that any one who has received the washing of life continues in the practice of the licentious acts of transgressors.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:8
verses.text: Now he who sins after his baptism, unless he repent and forsake his sins, shall be condemned to hell-fire.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:9
verses.text: Concerning a Person Falsely Accused, or a Person Convicted.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:10
verses.text: VIII.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:11
verses.text: But if any one be maliciously prosecuted by the heathen, because he will not still go along with them to the same excess of riot, let him know that such a one is blessed of God, according as our Lord says in the Gospel: "Blessed are ye when men shall reproach you, or persecute you, or say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:12
verses.text: Rejoice and be exceeding glad, for your reward is great in heaven".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:13
verses.text: If, therefore, any one be slandered and falsely accused, such a one is blessed; for the Scripture says, "A man that is a reprobate is not tried by God".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:14
verses.text: But if any one be convicted as having done a wicked action, such a one not only hurts himself, but occasions the whole body of the Church and its doctrine to be blasphemed; as if we Christians did not practice those things that we declare to be good and honest, and we ourselves shall be reproached by the Lord, that "they say and do not".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:15
verses.text: Wherefore the bishop must boldly reject such as these upon full conviction, unless they change their course of life.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:16
verses.text: That a Bishop Ought Not to Receive Bribes.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:17
verses.text: IX.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:18
verses.text: For the bishop must not only himself give no offence, but must be no respecter of persons; in meekness instructing those that offend.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:19
verses.text: But if he himself has not a good conscience, and is a respecter of persons for the sake of filthy lucre, and receiving of bribes, and spares the open offender, and permits him to continue in the Church, he disregards the voice of God and of our Lord, which says, "Thou shalt exactly execute right judgment".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:20
verses.text: "Thou shalt not accept persons in judgment: thou shalt not justify the ungodly".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:21
verses.text: "Thou shalt not receive gifts against any one's life; for gifts do blind the eyes of the wise, and pervert the words of the righteous".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:22
verses.text: And elsewhere He says: "Take away from among yourselves that wicked person".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:23
verses.text: And Solomon says in his Proverbs: "Cast out a pestilent fellow from the congregation, and strife will go out along with him".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:24
verses.text: That a Bishop Who by Wrong Judgment Spares an Offender is Himself Guilty.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:25
verses.text: X.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:26
verses.text: But he who does not consider these things, will, contrary to justice, spare him who deserves punishment; as Saul spared Agag, and Eli his sons, "who knew not the Lord".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:27
verses.text: Such a one profanes his own dignity, and that Church of God which is in his parish.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:28
verses.text: Such a one is esteemed unjust before God and holy men, as affording occasion of scandal to many of the newly baptized, and to the catechumens; as also to the youth of both sexes, to whom a woe belongs, add "a mill-stone about his neck," and drowning, on account of his guilt.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:29
verses.text: For, observing what a person their governor is, through his wickedness and neglect of justice they will grow sceptical, and, indulging the same disease, will be compelled to perish with him; as was the case of the people joining with Jeroboam, and those which were in the conspiracy with Corah.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:30
verses.text: But if the offender sees that the bishop and deacons are innocent and unblameable, and the flock pure, he will either not venture to despise their authority, and to enter into the Church of God at all, as one smitten by his own conscience: or if he values nothing, and ventures to enter in, either he will be convicted immediately, as Uzza at the ark, when he touched it to support it; and as Achan, when he stole the accursed thing; and as Gehazi, when he coveted the money of Naaman, and so will be immediately punished: or else he will be admonished by the pastor, and drawn to repentance.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:31
verses.text: For when he looks round the whole Church one by one, and can spy no blemish, neither in the bishop nor in the people who are under his care, he will be put to confusion, and pricked at the heart, and in a peaceable manner will go his way with shame and many tears, and the flock will remain pure.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:32
verses.text: He will apply himself to God with tears, and will repent of his sins, and have hope.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:33
verses.text: Nay, the whole flock, at the sight of his tears, will be instructed, because a sinner avoids destruction by repentance.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:34
verses.text: How a Bishop Ought to Judge Offenders.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:35
verses.text: XI.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:36
verses.text: Upon this account, therefore, O bishop, endeavour to be pure in thy actions, and to adorn thy place and dignity, which is that of one sustaining the character of God among men, as being set over all men, over priests, kings, rulers, fathers, children, teachers, and in general over all those who are subject to thee: and so sit in the Church when thou speakest, as having authority to judge offenders.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:37
verses.text: For to you, O bishops, it is said: "Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven; and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:38
verses.text: Instruction as to How a Bishop Ought to Behave Himself to the Penitent.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:39
verses.text: XII.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:40
verses.text: Do thou therefore, O bishop, judge with authority like God, yet receive the penitent; for God is a God of mercy.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:41
verses.text: Rebuke those that sin, admonish those that are not converted, exhort those that stand to persevere in their goodness, receive the penitent; for the Lord God has promised with an oath to afford remission to the penitent for what things they have done amiss.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:42
verses.text: For He says by Ezekiel: "Speak unto them, As I live, saith the Lord, I would not the death of a sinner, but that the wicked turn from his evil way, and live.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:43
verses.text: Turn ye therefore front your evil ways; for why will ye die, O house of Israel?" Here the word affords hope to sinners, that if they will repent they shall have hope of salvation, lest otherwise out of despair they yield themselves up to their transgressions; but that, having hope of salvation, they may he converted, and may address to God with tears, on account of their sins, and may repent from their hearts, and so appease His displeasure towards them; so shall they receive a pardon from Him, as from a merciful Father.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:44
verses.text: That We Ought to Beware How We Make Trial of Any Sinful Course.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:45
verses.text: XIII.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:46
verses.text: Yet it is very necessary that those who are yet innocent should continue so, and not make an experiment what sin is, that they may not have occasion for trouble, sorrow, and those lamentations which are in order to forgiveness.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:47
verses.text: For how dost thou know, O man, when thou sinnest, whether thou shalt live any number of days in this present state, that thou mayest have time to repent? For the time of thy departure out of this world is uncertain; and if thou diest in sin, there will remain no repentance for thee; as God says by David, "In the grave who will confess to Thee?" It behoves us, therefore, to be ready in the doing of our duty, that so we may await our passage into another world without sorrow.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:48
verses.text: Wherefore also the Divine Word exhorts, speaking to thee by the wise Solomon, "Prepare thy works against thy exit, and provide all beforehand in the field," lest some of the things necessary to thy journey be wanting; as the oil of piety was deficient in the five foolish virgins mentioned in the Gospel, when they, on account of their having extinguished their lamps of divine knowledge, were shut out of the bride-chamber.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:49
verses.text: Wherefore he who values the security of his soul will take care to be out of danger, by keeping free from sin, that so he may preserve the advantage of his former good works to himself.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:50
verses.text: Do thou, therefore, so judge as executing judgment for God.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:51
verses.text: For, as the Scripture says, "the judgment is the Lord's".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:52
verses.text: In the first place, therefore, condemn the guilty person with authority; afterwards try to bring him home with mercy and compassion, and readiness to receive him, promising him salvation if he will change his course of life, and become a penitent; and when he does repent, and has submitted to his chastisement, receive him: remembering that our Lord has said, "There is joy in heaven over one sinner that repenteth".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:53
verses.text: Concerning Those Who Affirm that Penitents are Not to Be Received into the Church.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:54
verses.text: That a Righteous Person, Although He Converse with a Sinner, Will Not Perish with Him.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:55
verses.text: That No Person is Punished for Another, But Every One Must Give an Account of Himself.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:56
verses.text: That We Must Assist Those Who are Weak in the Faith; And that a Bishop Must Not Be Governed by Any Turbulent Person Among the Laity.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:57
verses.text: XIV.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:58
verses.text: But if thou refusest to receive him that repents, thou exposest him to those who lie in wait to destroy, forgetting what David says: "Deliver not my soul, which confesses to Thee, unto destroying beasts".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:59
verses.text: Wherefore Jeremiah, when he is exhorting men to repentance, says thus: "Shall not he that falleth arise? or he that turneth away, cannot he return? Wherefore have my people gone back by a shameless backsliding? and they are hardened in their purpose.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:60
verses.text: Turn, ye backsliding children, and I will heal your backslidings".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:61
verses.text: Receive, therefore, without any doubting, him that repents.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:62
verses.text: Be not hindered by such unmerciful men, who say that we must not be defiled with such as those, nor so much as speak to them: for such advice is from men that are unacquainted with God and His providence, and are unreasonable judges, and unmerciful brutes.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:63
verses.text: These men are ignorant that we ought to avoid society with offenders, not in discourse, but in actions: for "the righteousness of the righteous shall be upon him, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be upon him".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:64
verses.text: And again: "If a land sinneth against me by trespassing grievously, and I stretch out my hand upon it, and break the staff of bread upon it, and send famine upon it, and destroy man and beast therein: though these three men, Noah, Job, and Daniel, were in the midst of it, they shall only save their own souls by their righteousness, saith the Lord God".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:65
verses.text: The Scripture most clearly shows that a righteous man that converses with a wicked man does not perish with him.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:66
verses.text: For in the present world the righteous and the wicked are mingled together in the common affairs of life, but not in holy communion: and in this the friends and favourites of God are guilty of no sin.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:67
verses.text: For they do but imitate "their Farther which is in heaven, who maketh His sun to rise on the righteous and unrighteous, and sendeth His rain on the evil and on the good;" and the righteous man undergoes no peril on this account.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:68
verses.text: For those who conquer and those who are conquered are in the same place of running, but only those who have bravely undergone the race are where the garland is bestowed; and "no one is crowned, unless he strive lawfully".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:69
verses.text: For every one shall give account of himself, and God will not destroy the righteous with the wicked; for with Him it is a constant rule, that innocence is never punished.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:70
verses.text: For neither did He drown Noah, nor burn up Lot, nor destroy Rahab for company.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:71
verses.text: And if you desire to know how this matter was among us, Judas was one of us, and took the like part of the ministry which we had; and Simon the magician received the seal of the Lord.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:72
verses.text: Yet both the one and the other proving wicked, the former hanged himself, and the latter, as he flew in the air in a manner unnatural, was dashed against the earth.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:73
verses.text: Moreover, Noah and his sons with him were in the ark; but Ham, who alone was found wicked, received punishment in his son.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:74
verses.text: But if fathers are not punished for their children, nor children for their fathers, it is thence clear that neither will wives be punished for their husbands, nor servants for their masters, nor one relation for another, nor one friend for another, nor the righteous for the wicked.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:75
verses.text: But every one will be required an account of his own doing.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:76
verses.text: For neither was punishment inflicted on Noah for the world, nor was Lot destroyed by fire for the Sodomites, nor was Rahab slain for the inhabitants of Jericho, nor Israel for the Egyptians.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:77
verses.text: For not the dwelling together, but the agreement in their sentiments, alone could condemn the righteous with the wicked.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:78
verses.text: We ought not therefore to hearken to such persons who call for death, and hate mankind, and love accusations, and under fair pretences bring men to death.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:79
verses.text: For one man shall not die for another, but "every one is held with the chains of his own sins".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:80
verses.text: And, "behold, the man and his work is before his face".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:81
verses.text: Now we ought to assist those who are with us, and are in danger, and fall, and, as far as lies in our power, to reduce them to sobriety by our exhortations, and so save them from death.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:82
verses.text: For "the whole have no need of the physician, but the sick;" since "it is not pleasing in the sight of your Father that one of these little ones should perish".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:83
verses.text: For we ought not to establish the will of hard-hearted men, but the will of the God and Father of the universe, which is revealed to us by Jesus Christ our Lord, to whom be glory for ever, Amen.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:84
verses.text: For it is not equitable that thou, O bishop, who art the head, shouldst submit to the tail, that is, to some seditious person among the laity, to the destruction of another, but to God alone.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:85
verses.text: For it is thy privilege to govern those under thee, but not to be governed by them.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:86
verses.text: For neither does a son, who is subject by the course of generation, govern his father; nor a slave, who is subject by law, govern his master; nor does a scholar govern his teacher, nor a soldier his king, nor any of the laity his bishop.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:87
verses.text: For that there is no reason to suppose that such as converse with the wicked, in order to their instruction in the word, are defiled by or partake of their sins, Ezekiel, as it were on purpose preventing the suspicions of ill-disposed persons, says thus: "Why do you speak this proverb concerning the land of Israel? The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children's teeth are set on edge.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:88
verses.text: As I live, saith the Lord God, ye shall not henceforth have occasion to use this proverb in Israel.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:89
verses.text: For all souls are mine, in like manner as the soul of the father, so also the soul of the son is mine: the soul that sinneth, it shall die.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:90
verses.text: But the man who is righteous, and does judgment and justice" (and so the prophet reckons up the rest of the virtues, and then adds for a conclusion, "Such a one is just"), "he shall surely live, saith the Lord God.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:91
verses.text: And if he beget a son who is a robber, a shedder of blood, and walks not in the way of his righteous father" (and when the prophet had added what follows, he adds in the conclusion), "he shall certainly not live: he has done all this wickedness; he shall surely die; his blood shall be upon him.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:92
verses.text: Yet they will ask thee, Why? Does not the son bear the iniquity of the father; or his righteousness, having exercised righteousness and mercy himself? And thou shalt say unto them, The soul that sinneth, it shall die.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:93
verses.text: The son shall not bear the iniquity of the father, and the father shall not bear the iniquity of the son.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:94
verses.text: The righteousness of the righteous shall be upon him, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be upon him".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:95
verses.text: And a little after he says: "When the righteous turneth away from his righteousness, and committeth iniquity, all his righteousness, by reason of all his wickedness which he has committed, shall not be mentioned to him: in his iniquity which he hath committed, and in his sin which he hath sinned, in them shall he die".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:96
verses.text: And a little after he adds: "When the wicked turneth away from his wickedness which he hath committed, and doth judgment and justice, he hath preserved his soul, he hath turned away from all his ungodliness which he hath done; he shall surely live, he shall not die".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:97
verses.text: And afterwards: "I will judge every one of you according to his ways, O house of Israel, saith the Lord God".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:98
verses.text: That a Priest Must Neither Overlook Offences, Nor Be Rash in Punishing Them.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:99
verses.text: XV.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:100
verses.text: Observe, you who are our beloved sons, how merciful yet righteous the Lord our God is; how gracious and kind to men; and yet most certainly "He will not acquit the guilty:" though He welcomes the returning sinner, and revives him, leaving no room for suspicion to such as wish to judge sternly and to reject offenders entirely, and to refuse to vouchsafe to them exhortations which might bring them to repentance.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:101
verses.text: In contradiction to such, God by Isaiah says to the bishops: "Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, ye priests: speak comfortably to Jerusalem".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:102
verses.text: It therefore behoves you, upon hearing those words of His, to encourage those who have offended, and lead them to repentance, and afford them hope, and not vainly to suppose that you shall be partakers of their offences on account of such your love to them.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:103
verses.text: Receive the penitent with alacrity, and rejoice over them, and with mercy and bowels of compassion judge the sinners.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:104
verses.text: For if a person was walking by the side of a river, and ready to stumble, and thou shouldest push him and thrust him into the river, instead of offering him thy hand for his assistance, thou wouldst be guilty of the murder of thy brother; whereas thou oughtest rather to lend thy helping hand as he was ready to fall, lest he perish without remedy, that both the people may take warning, and the offender may not utterly perish.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:105
verses.text: It is thy duty, O bishop, neither to overlook the sins of the people, nor to reject those who are penitent, that thou mayst not unskilfully destroy the Lord's flock, or dishonour His new name, which is imposed on His people, and thou thyself beest reproached as those ancient pastors were, of whom God speaks thus to Jeremiah: "Many shepherds have destroyed my vineyard; they have polluted my heritage".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:106
verses.text: And in another passage: "My anger is waxed hot against the shepherds, and against the lambs shall I have indignation".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:107
verses.text: And elsewhere: "Ye are the priests that dishonour my name".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:108
verses.text: Of Repentance, the Manner of It, and Rules About It.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:109
verses.text: XVI.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:110
verses.text: When thou seest the offender, with severity command him to be cast out; and as he is going out, let the deacons also treat him with severity, and then let them go and seek for him, and detain him out of the Church; and when they come in, let them entreat thee for him.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:111
verses.text: For our Saviour Himself entreated His Father for those who had sinned, as it is written in the Gospel: "Father, forgive them; for they know not what they do".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:112
verses.text: Then order the offender to come in; and if upon examination thou findest that he is penitent, and fit to be received at all into the Church when thou hast afflicted him his days of fasting, according to the degree of his offence—as two, three, five, or seven weeks—so set him at liberty, and speak such things to him as are fit to be said in way of reproof, instruction, and exhortation to a sinner for his reformation, that so he may continue privately in his humility, and pray to God to be merciful to him, saying: "If Thou, O Lord, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who should stand? For with Thee there is propitiation".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:113
verses.text: Of this sort of declaration is that which is said in the book of Genesis to Cain: "Thou hast sinned; be quiet;" that is, do not go on in sin.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:114
verses.text: For that a sinner ought to be ashamed for his own sin, that oracle of God delivered to Moses concerning Miriam is a sufficient proof, when he prayed that she might be forgiven.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:115
verses.text: For says God to him: "If her father had spit in her face, should she not be ashamed? Let her be shut out of the camp seven days, and afterwards let her come in again".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:116
verses.text: We therefore ought to do so with offenders, when they profess their repentance,—namely, to separate them some determinate time, according to the proportion of their offence, and afterwards, like fathers to children, receive them again upon their repentance.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:117
verses.text: That a Bishop Must Be Unblameable, and a Pattern for Those Who are Under His Charge.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:118
verses.text: XVII.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:119
verses.text: But if the bishop himself be an offender, how will he be able any longer to prosecute the offence of another? Or how will he be able to reprove another, either he or his deacons, if by accepting of persons, or receiving of bribes, they have not all a clear conscience? For when the ruler asks, and the judge receives, judgment is not brought to perfection; but when both are "companions of thieves, and regardless of doing justice to the widows," those who are under the bishop will not be able to support and vindicate him: for they will say to him what is written in the Gospel, "Why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?" Let the bishop, therefore, with his deacons, dread to bear any such thing; that is, let him give no occasion for it.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:120
verses.text: For an offender, when he sees any other doing as bad as himself, will be encouraged to do the very same things; and then the wicked one, taking occasion from a single instance, works in others, which God forbid: and by that means the flock will be destroyed.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:121
verses.text: For the greater number of offenders there are, the greater is the mischief that is done by them: for sin which passes without correction grows worse and worse, and spreads to others; since "a little leaven infects the whole lump," and one thief spreads the abomination over a whole nation and "dead flies spoil the whole pot of sweet ointment;" and "when a king hearkens to unrighteous counsel, all the servants under him are wicked".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:122
verses.text: So one scabbed sheep, if not separated from those that are whole, infects the rest with the same distemper; and a man infected with the plague is to be avoided by all men; and a mad dog is dangerous to every one that he touches.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:123
verses.text: If, therefore, we neglect to separate the transgressor from the Church of God, we shall make the "Lord's house a den of thieves".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:124
verses.text: For it is the bishop's duty not to be silent in the case of offenders, but to rebuke them, to exhort them, to beat them down, to afflict them with fastings, that so he may strike a pious dread into the rest: for, as He says, "make ye the children of Israel pious".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:125
verses.text: For the bishop must be one who discourages sin by his exhortations, and sets a pattern of righteousness, and proclaims those good things which are prepared by God, and declares that wrath which will come at the day of judgment, lest he contemn and neglect the plantation of God; and, on account of his carelessness, hear that which is said in Hosea: "Why have ye held your peace at impiety, and have reaped the fruit thereof?"  That a Bishop Must Take Care that His People Do Not Sin, Considering that He is Set for a Watchman Among Them.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:126
verses.text: XVIII.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:127
verses.text: Let the bishop, therefore, extend his concern to all sorts of people: to those who have not offended, that they may continue innocent; to those who offend, that they may repent.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:128
verses.text: For to you does the Lord speak thus: "Take heed that ye offend not one of these little ones".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:129
verses.text: It is your duty also to give remission to the penitent.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:130
verses.text: For as soon as ever one who has offended says, in the sincerity of his soul, "I have sinned against the Lord," the Holy Spirit answers, "The Lord also hath forgiven thy sin; be of good cheer, thou shalt not die".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:131
verses.text: Be sensible, therefore, O bishop, of the dignity of thy place, that as thou hast received the power of binding, so hast thou also that of loosing.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:132
verses.text: Having therefore the power of loosing, know thyself, and behave thyself in this world as becomes thy place, being aware that thou hast a great account to give.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:133
verses.text: "For to whom," as the Scripture says, "men have entrusted much, of him they will require the more".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:134
verses.text: For no one man is free from sin, excepting Him that was made man for us; since it is written: "No man is pure from filthiness; no, not though he be but one day old".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:135
verses.text: Upon which account the lives and conduct of the ancient holy men and patriarchs are described; not that we may reproach them from our reading, but that we ourselves may repent, and have hope that we also shall obtain forgiveness.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:136
verses.text: For their blemishes are to us both security and admonition, because we hence learn, when we have offended, that if we repent we shall have pardon.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:137
verses.text: For it is written: "Who can boast that he has a clean heart? and who dare affirm that he is pure from sin?" No man, therefore, is without sin.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:138
verses.text: Do thou therefore labour to the utmost of thy power to be unblameable; and be solicitous of all the parts of thy flock, lest any one be scandalized on thy account, and thereby perish.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:139
verses.text: For the layman is solicitous only for himself, but thou for all, as having a greater burden, and carrying a heavier load.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:140
verses.text: For it is written: "And the Lord said unto Moses, Thou and Aaron shall bear the sins of the priesthood".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:141
verses.text: Since, therefore, thou art to give an account of all, take care of all.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:142
verses.text: Preserve those that are sound, admonish those that sin; and when thou hast afflicted them with fasting, give them ease by remission; and when with tears the offender begs readmission, receive him, and let the whole Church pray for him; and when by imposition of thy hand thou hast admitted him, give him leave to abide afterwards in the flock.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:143
verses.text: But for the drowsy and the careless, do thou endeavour to convert and confirm, and warn and cure them, as sensible how great a reward thou shalt have for doing so, and how great danger thou wilt incur if thou beest negligent therein.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:144
verses.text: For Ezekiel speaks thus to those overseers who take no care of the people: "Woe unto the shepherds of Israel, for they have fed themselves; the shepherds feed not the sheep, but themselves.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:145
verses.text: Ye eat the milk, and are clothed with the wool; ye slay the strong, ye do not feed the sheep.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:146
verses.text: The weak have ye not strengthened, neither have ye healed that which was sick, neither have ye bound up that which was broken, neither have ye brought again that which was driven away, neither have ye sought that which was lost; but, violently ye chastised them with insult: and they were scattered, because there was no shepherd; and they became meat to all the beasts of the forest".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:147
verses.text: And again: "The shepherds did not search for my sheep; and the shepherds fed themselves, but they fed not my sheep".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:148
verses.text: And a little after: "Behold, I am against the shepherds, and I will require my sheep at their hands, and cause them to cease from feeding my sheep, neither shall the shepherds feed themselves any more; and I will deliver my sheep out of their hands, and they shall not be meat for them".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:149
verses.text: And he also adds, speaking to the people: "Behold, I will judge between sheep and sheep, and between rams and rams.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:150
verses.text: Seemed it a small thing unto you to have eaten up the good pasture, and to have trodden down with your feet the residue of your pasture, and that the sheep have eaten what was trodden down with your feet? "And a little after He adds: "And ye shall know that I am the Lord, and you the sheep of my pasture; ye are my men, and I am your God, saith the Lord God".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:151
verses.text: That a Shepherd Who is Careless of His Sheep Will Be Condemned, and that a Sheep Which Will Not Be Led by the Shepherd is to Be Punished.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:152
verses.text: XIX.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:153
verses.text: Hear, O ye bishops; and hear, O ye of the laity, how God speaks: "I will judge between ram and ram, and between sheep and sheep".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:154
verses.text: And He says to the shepherds: "Ye shall be judged for your unskilfulness, and for destroying the sheep".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:155
verses.text: That is, I will judge between one bishop and another, and between one lay person and another, and between one ruler and another (for these sheep and these rams are not irrational, but rational creatures): lest at any time a lay person should say, I am a sheep and not a shepherd, and I am not concerned for myself; let the shepherd look to that, for he alone will be required to give an account for me.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:156
verses.text: For as that sheep that will not follow its good shepherd is exposed to the wolves, to its destruction; so that which follows a bad shepherd is also exposed to unavoidable death, since his shepherd will devour him.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:157
verses.text: Wherefore care must be had to avoid destructive shepherds.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:158
verses.text: How the Governed are to Obey the Bishops Who are Set Over Them.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:159
verses.text: XX.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:160
verses.text: As to a good shepherd, let the lay person honour him, love him, reverence him as his lord, as his master, as the high priest of God, as a teacher of piety.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:161
verses.text: For he that heareth him, heareth Christ; and he that rejecteth him, rejecteth Christ; and he who does not receive Christ, does not receive His God and Father: for, says He, "He that heareth you, heareth me; and he that rejecteth you, rejecteth me; and he that rejecteth me, rejecteth Him that sent me".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:162
verses.text: In like manner, let the bishop love the laity as his children, fostering and cherishing them with affectionate diligence; as eggs, in order to the hatching of young ones; or as young ones, taking them in his arms, to the rearing them into birds: admonishing all men; reproving all who stand in need of reproof; reproving, that is, but not striking; beating them down to make them ashamed, but not overthrowing them; warning them in order to their conversion: chiding them in order to their reformation and better course of life; watching the strong, that is, keeping him firm in the faith who is already strong; feeding the people peaceably; strengthening the weak, that is, confirming with exhortation that which is tempted; healing that which is sick, that is, curing by instruction that which is weak in the faith through doubtfulness of mind; binding up that which is broken, that is, binding up by comfortable admonitions that which is gone astray, or wounded, bruised, or broken by their sins, and put out of the way; leasing it of its offences, and giving hope: by this means restore it in strength to the Church, bringing it back into the flock.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:163
verses.text: Bring again that which is driven away, that is, do not permit that which is in its sins, and is cast out by way of punishment, to continue excluded; but receiving it, and bringing it back, restore it to the flock, that is, to the people of the undefiled Church.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:164
verses.text: Seek for that which is lost, that is, do not suffer that which desponds of its salvation, by reason of the multitude of its offences, utterly to perish.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:165
verses.text: Do thou search for that which is grown sleepy, drowsy, and sluggish, and that which is unmindful of its own life, through the depth of its sleep, and which is at a great distance from its own flock, so as to be in danger of falling among the wolves, and being devoured by them.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:166
verses.text: Bring it back by admonition, exhort it to be watchful; and insinuate hope, not permitting it to say that which was said by some: "Our impieties are upon us, and we pine away in them; how shall we then live?" As far as possible, therefore, let the bishop make the offence his own, and say to the sinner, Do thou but return, and I will undertake to suffer death for thee, as our Lord suffered death for me, and for all men.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:167
verses.text: For "the good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep; but he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming, that is, the devil, and he leaveth the sheep, and fleeth, and the wolf seizes upon them".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:168
verses.text: We must know, therefore, that God is very merciful to those who have offended, and hath promised repentance with an oath.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:169
verses.text: But he who has offended, and is unacquainted with this promise of God concerning repentance, and does not understand His long-suffering and forbearance, and besides is ignorant of the Holy Scriptures, which proclaim repentance, inasmuch as he has never learned them from you, perishes through his folly.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:170
verses.text: But do thou, like a compassionate shepherd, and a diligent feeder of the flock, search out, and keep an account of thy flock.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:171
verses.text: Seek that which is wanting; as the Lord God our gracious Father has sent His own Son, the good Shepherd and Saviour, our Master Jesus, and has commanded Him to "leave the ninety-nine upon the mountains, and to go in search after that which was lost, and when He had found it, to take it upon His shoulders, and to carry it into the flock, rejoicing that He had found that which was lost".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:172
verses.text: In like manner, be obedient, O bishop, and do thou seek that which was lost, guide that which has wandered out of the right way, bring back that which is gone astray: for thou hast authority to bring them back, and to deliver those that are broken-hearted by remission.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:173
verses.text: For by thee does our Saviour say to him who is discouraged under the sense of his sins, "Thy sins are forgiven thee: thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:174
verses.text: But this peace and haven of tranquillity is the Church of Christ, into which do thou, when thou hast loosed them from their sins, restore them, as being now sound and unblameable, of good hope, diligent, laborious in good works.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:175
verses.text: As a skilful and compassionate physician, heal all such as have wandered in the ways of sin; for "they that are whole have no need of a physician, but they that are sick.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:176
verses.text: For the Son of man came to save and to seek that which was lost".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:177
verses.text: Since thou art therefore a physician of the Lord's Church, provide remedies suitable to every patient's case.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:178
verses.text: Cure them, heal them by all means possible; restore them sound to the Church.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:179
verses.text: Feed the flock, "not with insolence and contempt, as lording it over them," but as a gentle shepherd, "gathering the lambs into thy bosom, and gently leading those which are with young".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:180
verses.text: That It is a Dangerous Thing to Judge Without Hearing Both Sides, or to Determine of Punishment Against a Person Before He is Convicted.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:181
verses.text: XXI.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:182
verses.text: Be gentle, gracious, mild, without guile, without falsehood; not rigid, not insolent, not severe, not arrogant, not unmerciful, not puffed up, not a man-pleaser, not timorous, not double-minded, not one that insults over the people that are under thee, not one that conceals the divine laws and the promises to repentance, not hasty in thrusting out and expelling, but steady, not one that delights in severity, not heady.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:183
verses.text: Do not admit less evidence to convict any one than that of three witnesses, and those of known and established reputation; inquire whether they do not accuse out of ill-will or envy: for there are many that delight in mischief, forward in discourse, slanderous, haters of the brethren, making it their business to scatter the sheep of Christ; whose affirmation if thou admittest without nice scanning the same, thou wilt disperse thy flock, and betray it to be devoured by wolves, that is, by demons and wicked men, or rather not men, but wild beasts in the shape of men—by the heathen, by the Jews, and by the atheistic heretics.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:184
verses.text: For those destroying wolves soon address themselves to any one that is cast out of the Church, and esteem him as a lamb delivered for them to devour, reckoning his destruction their own gain.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:185
verses.text: For he that is "their father, the devil, is a murderer".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:186
verses.text: He also who is separated unjustly by thy want of care in judging will be overwhelmed with sorrow, and be disconsolate, and so will either wander over to the heathen, or be entangled in heresies, and so will be altogether estranged from the Church and from hope in God, and will be entangled in impiety, whereby thou wilt be guilty of his perdition: for it is not fair to be too hasty in casting out an offender, but slow in receiving him when he returns; to be forward in cutting off, but unmerciful when he is sorrowful, and ought to be healed.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:187
verses.text: For of such as these speaks the divine Scripture: "Their feet run to mischief; they are hasty to shed blood.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:188
verses.text: Destruction and misery are in their ways, and the way of peace have they not known.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:189
verses.text: The fear of God is not before their eyes".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:190
verses.text: Now the way of peace is our Saviour Jesus Christ, who has taught us, saying: "Forgive, and ye shall be forgiven.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:191
verses.text: Give, and it shall be given to you;" that is, give remission of sins, and your offences shall be forgiven you.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:192
verses.text: As also He instructed us by His prayer to say unto God: "Forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:193
verses.text: If, therefore, you do not forgive offenders, how can you expect the remission of your own sins? Do not you rather bind yourselves faster, by pretending in your prayers to forgive, when you really do not forgive? Will you not be confronted with your own words, when you say you forgive and do not forgive? For know ye, that he who casts out one who has not behaved himself wickedly, or who will not receive him that returns, is a murderer of his brother, and sheds his blood, as Cain did that of his brother Abel, and his "blood cries to God," and will be required.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:194
verses.text: For a righteous man unjustly slain by any one will be in rest with God for ever.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:195
verses.text: The same is the case of him who without cause is separated by his bishop.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:196
verses.text: He who has cast him out as a pestilent fellow when he was innocent, is more furious than a murderer.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:197
verses.text: Such a one has no regard to the mercy of God, nor is mindful of His goodness to those that are penitent, nor keeping in his eye the examples of those who, having been once great offenders, received forgiveness upon their repentance.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:198
verses.text: Upon which account, he who casts off an innocent person is more cruel than he that murders the body.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:199
verses.text: In like manner, he who does not receive the penitent, scatters the flock of Christ, being really against Him.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:200
verses.text: For as God is just in judging of sinners, so is He merciful in receiving them when they return.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:201
verses.text: For David, the man after God's own heart, in his hymns ascribes both mercy and judgment to Him.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:202
verses.text: That David, the Ninevites, Hezekiah, and His Son Manasseh, are Eminent Examples of Repentance, the Prayer of Manasseh King of Judah.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:203
verses.text: XXII.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:204
verses.text: It is also thy duty, O bishop, to have before thine eyes the examples of those that have gone before, and to apply them skilfully to the cases of those who want words of severity or of consolation.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:205
verses.text: Besides, it is reasonable that in thy administration of justice thou shouldest follow the will of God; and as God deals with sinners, and with those who return, that thou shouldest act accordingly in thy judging.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:206
verses.text: Now, did not God by Nathan reproach David for his offence? And yet as soon as he said he repented, He delivered him from death, saying, "Be of good cheer; thou shalt not die".

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:207
verses.text: So also, when God had caused Jonah to be swallowed up by the sea and the whale, upon his refusal to preach to the Ninevites, when yet he prayed to Him out of the belly of the whale, He retrieved his life from corruption.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:208
verses.text: And when Hezekiah had been puffed up for a while, yet, as soon as he prayed with lamentation, He remitted his offence.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:209
verses.text: But, O ye bishops, hearken to an instance useful upon this occasion.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:210
verses.text: For it is written thus in the fourth book of Kings and the second book of Chronicles: "And Hezekiah died; and Manasseh his son reigned.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:211
verses.text: He was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem; and his mother's name was Hephzibah.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:212
verses.text: And he did evil in the sight of the Lord: he did not abstain from the abominations of the heathen, whom the Lord destroyed from the face of the children of Israel.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:213
verses.text: And Manasseh returned and built the high places which Hezekiah his father had overthrown; and he reared pillars for Baal, and set up an altar for Baal, and made groves, as did Ahab king of Israel.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:214
verses.text: And he made altars in the house of the Lord, of which the Lord spake to David and to Solomon his son, saying, Therein will I put my name.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:215
verses.text: And Manasseh set up altars, and by them served Baal, and said, My name shall continue for ever.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:216
verses.text: And he built altars to the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the Lord; and he made his children pass through the fire in a place named Ge Benennom; and he consulted enchanters, and dealt with wizards and familiar spirits, and with conjurers and observers of times, and with teraphim.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:217
verses.text: And he sinned exceedingly in the eyes of the Lord, to provoke Him to anger.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:218
verses.text: And he set a molten and a graven image, the image of his grove, which he made in the house of the Lord, wherein the Lord had chosen to put His name in Jerusalem, the holy city, for ever, and had said, I will no more remove my foot from the land of Israel, which I gave to their fathers; only if they will observe to do according to all that I have commanded them, and according to all the precepts that my servant Moses commanded them.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:219
verses.text: And they hearkened not.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:220
verses.text: And Manasseh seduced them to do more evil before the Lord than did the nations whom the Lord cast out from the face of the children of Israel.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:221
verses.text: And the Lord spake concerning Manasseh and concerning His people by the hand of His servants the prophets, saying, Because Manasseh king of Judah has done all these wicked abominations in a higher degree than the Amorite did which was before him, and hath made Judah to sin with his idols, thus saith the Lord God of Israel, Behold, I bring evils upon Jerusalem and Judah, that whosoever heareth of them, both his ears shall tingle.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:222
verses.text: And I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab; and I will blot out Jerusalem as a table-book is blotted out by wiping it.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:223
verses.text: And I will turn it upside down; and I will give up the remnant of my inheritance, and will deliver them into the hands of their enemies, and they shall become a prey and a spoil to all their enemies, because of all the evils which they have done in mine eyes, and have provoked me to anger from the day that I brought their fathers out of the land of Egypt even until this day.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:224
verses.text: Moreover, Manasseh shed innocent blood very much, till he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another, beside his sins wherewith he made Judah to sin in doing evil in the sight of the Lord.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:225
verses.text: And the Lord brought upon him the captains of the host of the king of Assyria, and they caught Manasseh in bonds, and they bound him in fetters of brass, and brought him to Babylon; and he was bound and shackled with iron all over in the house of the prison.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:226
verses.text: And bread made of bran was given unto him scantily, and by weight, and water mixed with vinegar but a little and by measure, so much as would keep him alive; and he was in straits and sore affliction.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:227
verses.text: And when he was violently afflicted, he besought the face of the Lord his God, and humbled himself greatly before the face of the Lord God of his fathers.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:228
verses.text: And he prayed unto the Lord, saying, O Lord, almighty God of our fathers Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and of their righteous seed, who hast made heaven and earth, with all the ornament thereof, who hast bound the sea by the word of Thy commandment, who hast shut up the deep, and sealed it by Thy terrible and glorious name, whom all men fear and tremble before Thy power; for the majesty of Thy glory cannot be borne, and Thine angry threatening towards sinners is insupportable.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:229
verses.text: But Thy merciful promise is unmeasurable and unsearchable; for Thou art the most high Lord, of great compassion, long-suffering, very merciful, and repentest of the evils of men.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:230
verses.text: Thou, O Lord, according to Thy great goodness, hast promised repentance and forgiveness to them that have sinned against Thee, and of Thine infinite mercy hast appointed repentance unto sinners, that they may be saved.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:231
verses.text: Thou therefore, O Lord, that art the God of the just, has not appointed repentance to the just as to Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, which have not sinned against Thee; but Thou hast appointed repentance unto me that am a sinner: for I have sinned above the number of the sands of the sea.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:232
verses.text: My transgressions, O Lord, are multiplied; my transgressions are multiplied, and I am not worthy to behold and see the height of heaven for the multitude of mine iniquity.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:233
verses.text: I am bowed down with many iron bands; for I have provoked Thy wrath, and done evil before Thee, setting up abominations, and multiplying offences.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:234
verses.text: Now, therefore, I bow the knee of mine heart, beseeching Thee of grace.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:235
verses.text: I have sinned, O Lord, I have sinned, and I acknowledge mine iniquities; wherefore I humbly beseech Thee, forgive me, O Lord, forgive me, and destroy me not with mine iniquities.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:236
verses.text: Be not angry with me for ever, by reserving evil for me; neither condemn me into the lower part of the earth.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:237
verses.text: For Thou art the God, even the God of them that repent, and in me Thou wilt show Thy goodness; for Thou wilt save me that am unworthy, according to Thy great mercy.

verses.name: Constitutions of the Holy Apostles Book II 3:238
